actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 with respect to the targeted jobs credit.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase from $6,000 to $10,000 the amount of wages taken into account for purposes of the targeted jobs tax credit. Repeals the termination date for such credit. Reduces the age limit for the targeted group of economically disadvantaged youth from 18 to 16. Limits such age reduction to only those youths engaged in summer employment. Limits the targeted group of involuntarily terminated CETA employees to those terminated within three years of the hiring date.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 with respect to the targeted jobs credit.
